Job Title: Agile Business Analyst

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Remote - Full Time (W2)

This position is contingent upon award

Our team is supporting various critical initiatives to build secure, high performing digital services to streamline the process of obtaining immigration benefits into the United States, resulting in decreased immigration times, increased security, and a massive reduction on the reliance of paper-based processes. Apply today to learn how your valuable experience can support our dynamic team!

Required Qualifications

5+ years of experience as a business analyst or in similar role. Outstanding customer facing, communication, and documentation skills. Prior experience working on large-scale programs using an Agile delivery methodology. Experience working with technical software development teams. Experience with different Project Management tools 

Role Responsibilities

Develop and maintain professional business relations with Government clients. Effectively interact with agile team members across the entire organization to meet clientsâ€™ needs. Conduct frequent meetings with legal counsel on the development of new technical functionality. Present demonstrations of newly built functionality to upper management as well as the internal users of the system. Travel to onsite locations to gather specific client requirements for new or enhanced functionality. Be the liaison between the development team and the government client. Assist with conducting analysis to determine the best path for solving business problems/opportunities, which may include process improvement, systems enhancement, or user training. Interact regularly with the various levels of customer management in supporting the development of system engineering and deployment efforts. Conduct reviews and analysis of organizational needs and goals and present recommendations. Assist with facilitating planning sessions with management. Evaluate and present information to enable effective and timely decision-making through written and oral communication materials, which effectively summarize findings with recommendations. Work with program leaders to identify business needs and prioritization. 

Position Benefits

Competitive compensation package Paid vacation and holidays Health care package Training opportunities

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
